name: places/ChIJfzalyItZwokROn8BaJn9jyY
formattedAddress: 103 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 103 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Haute, minimalist showcase for the eponymous designer's edgy men's & women's clothing & accessories.

originalText.text: Cannot validate other people’s experiences but I have nothing but positive things to say about the staff as I’ve witnessed first hand. Everyone at the sales floor is super friendly, attentive and helpful- even if there’s a language barrier as many customers are tourists.. the staff does their best to accommodate and communicate. Kudos!

originalText.text: Terrible experience. Extremely rude staff. The scene you’ll see all the time is them standing there, playing with their phones.

text.text: Terrible experience. Extremely rude staff. The scene you’ll see all the time is them standing there, playing with their phones.

originalText.text: I called in and consulted with a store worker and she was very helpful throughout my entire experience.Riri helped me to get everything that was on my wishlist ,the pricing for everything was very great and especially for the new seasons collection ❤️❤️. Definitely a 5/5!

text.text: I called in and consulted with a store worker and she was very helpful throughout my entire experience.Riri helped me to get everything that was on my wishlist ,the pricing for everything was very great and especially for the new seasons collection ❤️❤️. Definitely a 5/5!

originalText.text: If I could give 0 starts I would. I purchased a top in store on March 17th and tried to make the return on Monday March 20th, after trying to wear it the day before for my birthday.Tried to make an in store return at the flagship location, after the top I purchased less than a week ago ripped at the armhole seam while putting it on. Victoria, the supervisor racially profiled me & assumed I was lying and that the top ripped from me wearing it. Said she would escalate the issue to corporate and I would hear back by Wednesday. It’s Wednesday, so I call when I don’t hear back from them. I spoke with Darien, the store manager who said to give her a few and she would get back to me. Again, heard nothing so I reached out again right before store closing.  So not only did I have no outfit for me birthday, now Darien, the store manager is telling me my item has excessive wear and tear and is refusing to give me a refund and says she can only dry clean it. Why would I want a ripped top that I can’t wear dry cleaned? Why would I even want the top back if it’s ripped at the armhole seam! I work in fashion, i under cut & sew items. So you can’t tell me, it happened from excessive wear & tear when I haven’t even had the top for a week! I would think after the sexual assault aggregations their customer service would’ve improved, but I have several Alexander wang items, which disappoints me because now I never want to purchase another thing from here.

originalText.text: I don’t even know what the sales are doing in this store. I wanted to try something on and nobody was even there to register me for the waiting room. Plus, my boyfriend already told one of the Chinese sales I would be in store today to pick something up, and when I asked for her she’s nowhere to be found. Had to guess who that person is and went up to her to try something on and had to wait for the waiting room in a store where there’s only about four customers. Super disappointed in this one. If you like Alexander Wang try somewhere else.
